Merge multiple Boolean code variables into new collapsed codes

Source: R/merge_codes.R
merge_codes.Rd

This function takes a dataset with Boolean (logical) code variables and collapses groups of them into new variables. For each new code, the function assigns TRUE if any of the specified source variables are TRUE (ignoring NA), and then removes the original source variables from the dataset.

Usage

merge_codes(data, merges)

Arguments

data

A data.frame or tibble containing the code variables.

merges

A named list, where each element name is the name of a new variable to create, and the value is a character vector of variable names to merge together.

Value

A data.frame with the new collapsed variables added and the original source variables removed.

Examples

library(dplyr)

# Example dataset
excerpts <- tibble(
  Destigmatization = c(TRUE, FALSE, FALSE),
  `Shift in MH/S norms` = c(FALSE, TRUE, FALSE),
  c_sense_of_belonging = c(FALSE, FALSE, TRUE),
  c_sense_of_connectedness = c(TRUE, FALSE, FALSE),
  c__suicide_comfort_directing_change = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE),
  c__suicide_comfort_general = c(FALSE, TRUE, FALSE)
)

# Collapse multiple groups of codes into new variables
merged <- merge_codes(excerpts, list(
  Destigmatization = c("Destigmatization", "Shift in MH/S norms"),
  Belonging_and_Connectedness = c("c_sense_of_belonging", "c_sense_of_connectedness"),
  c__suicide_comfort = c("c__suicide_comfort_directing_change", "c__suicide_comfort_general")
))

merged
#> # A tibble: 3 × 2
#>   Belonging_and_Connectedness c__suicide_comfort
#>   <lgl>                       <lgl>             
#> 1 TRUE                        TRUE              
#> 2 FALSE                       TRUE              
#> 3 TRUE                        TRUE
